```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(rvest)
set.seed(1)
```

## Simple Z-Score function

```{r}
x_vec = rnorm(30, mean = 5, sd = 3)

# computing z-scores
(x_vec - mean(x_vec)) / sd(x_vec)
```

```{r}
z_scores = function(x) {
  
  z = (x - mean(x)) / sd(x)
  
  return(z)
  
}

z_scores(x_vec)
```

Using z_scores with other things. These should give errors.

```{r, error = TRUE}
z_scores(3)
z_scores("my_name_is_aj")
z_scores(mtcars)
z_scores(c(TRUE, TRUE, FALSE, TRUE))
```

Revising z_scores

```{r}
z_scores = function(x) {
  
  if (!is.numeric(x)) {
    stop("Input must be numeric")
  }
  
  if (length(x) < 3) {
    stop("Input must have at least numbers")
  }
    
  z = (x - mean(x)) / sd(x)
  
  return(z)
  
}

z_scores(x_vec)
```

## Functions with multiple outputs

```{r}
mean_and_sd = function(x) {
  
  if (!is.numeric(x)) {
    stop("Input must be numeric")
  }
  
  if (length(x) < 3) {
    stop("Input must have at least numbers")
  }
    
  mean_x = mean(x)
  sd_x = sd(x)
  
  tibble(
    mean = mean_x,
    sd = sd_x
  )
  
}
```

Checking to see if function works

```{r}
x_vec = rnorm(1000)
mean_and_sd(x_vec)
```

## Multiple inputs

```{r}
sim_data = 
  tibble(
    x = rnorm(100, mean = 4, sd = 3)
  )

sim_data |> 
  summarize(
    mean = mean(x),
    sd = sd(x)
  )
```

Turning this into a function

```{r}
sim_mean_sd = function(samp_size, mu, sigma) {
  
  sim_data = 
  tibble(
    x = rnorm(n = samp_size, mean = mu, sd = sigma)
  )

  sim_data |> 
    summarize(
      mean = mean(x),
      sd = sd(x)
  )

}

# testing function
sim_mean_sd(100, 6, 3)
```
